title: Altair
summary: Altair (/ælˈtɛər/)[12] designated α Aquilae (Latinised to Alpha Aquilae, abbreviated Alpha Aql, α Aql), is the brightest star in the constellation of Aquila and the twelfth-brightest star in the night sky. It is currently in the G-cloud—a nearby interstellar cloud, an accumulation of gas and dust.[13][14] Altair is an A-type main-sequence star with an apparent visual magnitude of 0.77 and is one of the vertices of the Summer Triangle asterism (the other two vertices are marked by Deneb and Vega).[4][15][16] It is 16.7 light-years (5.1 parsecs) from the Sun and is one of the most visible stars to the naked eye.[17]
